title: COP16 on biodiversity: A source of national pride and a security challenge for Colombia
summary: Cali, the country's third-largest city, is preparing to welcome 12,000 participants.

title: Strikes intensify in Lebanon, Gaza and Israel after death of Hamas leader Sinwar
summary: Families of Israeli hostages call for a deal after Yahya Sinwar's killing. Missile and rocket fire continues unabated between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon.

title: With 16 days until Election Day, Harris urges Black churchgoers to vote in Georgia while Trump visits a fast-food
summary: Vice President Harris, who turned 60 Sunday, visited two Atlanta area churches as part of a push known as 'souls to the polls,' while the former Republican president made fun of her past student job at a McDonald's.

title: Moldovan president appears set to win first round of presidential race, but EU vote could be rejected according to partial results
summary: 'Criminal groups and hostile foreign forces have attacked our country with lies and propaganda,' said President Maia Sandu after about 90% of the votes had been counted.

title: After striking the Bahamas, Hurricane Oscar makes landfall in Cuba on third day of blackout
summary: Cuba's government said power would be reinstated for the majority of the country by Monday evening.

title: In Senegal, the president and prime minister's 'tradi-modern' style is very trendy
summary: Bassirou Diomaye Faye and Ousmane Sonko like to wear clothes inspired by the traditional boubou that also borrow a few details from Western fashion.

title: In Lebanon, Palestinians refugees have 'nothing left to lose'
summary: Following the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, representatives of different political camps in the Beddawi Palestinian refugee camp in northern Lebanon share a determination to continue 'resisting' Israel.

title: Europe's Euclid probe unveils the first pages of its sky atlas
summary: In revealing the initial piece of its grand map of the universe, the European Space Agency's mission is attempting to unravel the two great mysteries of cosmology: dark matter and dark energy.

title: Leclerc wins US Grand Prix and late penalty gives Verstappen 3rd place over Norris in title chase
summary: Charles Leclerc earned his third win of the season, Sunday, and gave Ferrari its first United States Grand Prix victory since 2018.

title: France says it has received assurances over sale of painkiller maker to US investment fund CD&R
summary: The proposed sale turned into a real political issue because Opella's products include Doliprane, the best-selling medicine in France.

title: Has France really become more right wing?
summary: Political scientist Vincent Tiberj, interviewed with ex-education minister Jean-Michel Blanquer, explains that the far-right Rassemblement National party's electoral surge doesn't reflect a rightward shift in French society.

title: Our selection of the 15 best apple tarts in France
summary: Cinnamon or caramel, rustic or very thin crust, vegan or sugar-free, here's our selection of the best apple-based desserts around the country.

title: Jewish leader Yonathan Arfi: 'For the first time since the Second World War, anti-Semitism is being fuelled at all levels of French society'
summary: The president of the Representative Council of French Jewish Institutions looks back at the shockwaves of the Hamas attack in Israel, and the anti-Semitic incidents that followed.

title: In Georgia, exile is the only option for many political opponents
summary: Many citizens are preparing to leave their country if the pro-Russian Georgian Dream party, in power since 2012, maintains its grip on power following the legislative elections on October 26.

title: At tribute for cyclist killed in Paris: 'What happened to Paul isn't an isolated case'
summary: Several hundred cyclists gathered at Place de la République on Saturday for a tribute to Paul Varry, the 27-year-old cyclist crushed by an SUV driver on Tuesday.

title: Back in the pool, French swimmer Léon Marchand wins three World Cup titles in Shanghai
summary: The French champion competed in swimming's short-course World Cup in Shanghai, in his first meet since taking the Paris Olympics by storm.

title: Harris and Trump prefer influencers and podcasters to mainstream media
summary: Both US presidential candidates have opted for minimal presence on TV and in the traditional press. Instead, they are focusing their campaigns on more targeted media, where they can avoid pushback.

title: Is Gen Z neglecting work, or are their older colleagues too quick to judge them?
summary: While numerous research studies are deconstructing stereotypes about new generations' relationship to work, the corporate world seems baffled as to how to manage its youngest employees.

title: COP16 on biodiversity: In Cali, countries will have to turn promises to halt nature's destruction into action
summary: The 16th World Biodiversity Conference opens on October 21 in Colombia, with the central issue being the implementation of the 2022 agreement, which aims to halt the loss of species and ecosystems by 2030.

title: Naomi Osaka's season is over because of injury
summary: The four-time Grand Slam singles champion said on Sunday, that she had ruptured abdominal muscles and will not play the Billie Jean King Cup finals in November.

title: Israel bombs Lebanese  company suspected of financing Hezbollah
summary: The Israeli Defence Minister told troops Sunday that the military was targeting places that Hezbollah 'planned to use as launchpads for attacks against Israel.' The UN peacekeeping force in Lebanon accused Israel of 'deliberately' destroying an observation tower in southern Lebanon.

title: In Haiti, gangs defy the multinational force
summary: Three months after the arrival of the first contingent of Kenyan police officers in Port-au-Prince, the multinational mission, mandated by the United Nations to support the Haitian police in their fight against criminal gangs, is showing mixed results.

title: 'We spent a lot.' How two years of denial led to France's budget crisis
summary: A parliamentary inquiry commission will look into the country's 'public finance slippage.' It will have to retrace the chain of errors and political decisions that led to 2024's predicted 6.1% deficit.

title: Lebanon's religious mosaic put to the test by war
summary: The village of Maaysra, a Shiite enclave in a Christian area in the mountains north of Beirut, has been bombed twice by Israeli aircraft.

title: Paris's ring road now has its own 50 km/h evaluation system
summary: The City of Paris has created a specific report for its ring road, to compare noise, traffic, accidents and pollution with the period before the speed limit was lowered from 70 km/h to 50 km/h.

title: US elections: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump's clashing worldviews
summary: On November 5, Americans will head to the polls to decide on the future of their country. They will also be weighing in on US foreign policy, a deeply polarizing issue between Democrats and Republicans.

title: Erdogan rival Fethullah Gulen dies in exile aged 83
summary: Gulen, who lived in the United States, was the bête noire of Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan who accused him of heading a 'terror organization.'

title: In France, senior citizens are (almost) king
summary: The aging population is absorbing an increasingly large share of the country's resources, to the detriment of investments in younger generations.

title: US takeover of prized French painkiller to go ahead
summary: Sanofi announced on Monday that it had entered into exclusive negotiations with US investment fund CD&R to sell it a majority stake in its over-the-counter subsidiary Opella.

title: Moldova president says 'won justly in unjust struggle' in EU referendum
summary: The country narrowly voted in favor of joining the European Union in a referendum marked by allegations of Russian interference.

title: Sneezing alpacas, hecklers and climate warnings: King Charles' lively visit to Australia's capital
summary: King Charles had a diverse range of experiences  Canberra on Monday. This was one of the busiest days in the nine-day visit to Australia and Samoa for the king on his first major foreign tour since his cancer diagnosis in February.

title: Putin hosts BRICS summit ahead of G20 he won't attend
summary: The Russian president is hosting the BRICS countries in Kazan, his alternative to the upcoming November G20 summit in Brazil. He has hosted an economic forum in Moscow the week before.

title: A very narrow victory for EU membership in Moldova
summary: The outgoing pro-European president, Maia Sandu, came out on top in the first round of the presidential election but fell short of the overwhelming support she had hoped for in the referendum, winning with only 50.39% of the vote, according to near-final results.

title: Colombia's fight against deforestation is hampered by deeply-rooted challenges
summary: Colombia, where the COP16 on biodiversity opened on October 21, has lost six million hectares of forest since 1990. The government is fighting both deforestation and drug production while contending with the presence of still-active armed groups.

title: Israel's 'campaign' to undermine humanitarian NGOs
summary: Since the start of the war in Gaza following the October 7, 2023 attacks, Israel has been restricting the activities of NGOs and UN agencies tasked with helping Palestinians, refusing to issue work visas and hindering the movements of staff in the field.

title: US elections: Harris and Trump backtrack on climate issues
summary: Kamala Harris, who needs to win Pennsylvania, a shale gas hotbed, no longer opposes fracking. Donald Trump continues to mock the effects of climate change.

title: Timothy Snyder: 'Americans are killing themselves with their misunderstanding of freedom'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the American historian argues that the US has a distorted idea of what freedom is, despite it being the country's most cherished value.

title: Macron to visit Morocco next week
summary: The French president will head to Morocco on a three-day state visit on October 28, the Moroccan royal palace said in a statement Monday, after three years of tense relations between the two countries.

title: The war in Lebanon through the lens of a Le Monde photographer: 'People are traumatized by the bombings and the pager attack'
summary: On September 24, photographer Adrienne Surprenant landed in Beirut. Three days later, an Israeli strike killed Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah. Surprenant tells us about her work for Le Monde in Lebanon and the challenges posed by the conflict.

title: At the Louis Vuitton Foundation, pop art or the art of a new realism
summary: The retrospective devoted to Tom Wesselmann and his contemporaries at the Parisian institution revisits the history of a movement that never stopped inventing.

title: President Biya returns to Cameroon amid health speculation
summary: The West African Nation's 91-year-old leader appeared on television after his plane landed, following weeks of speculation about his health and whereabouts after he vanished from public view after leaving Beijing in early September.

title: From train tickets to concert tickets, the unstoppable rise of dynamic pricing
summary: Dynamic pricing has spread throughout the economy, initially developed for the energy sector, then air travel and eventually e-commerce. With artificial intelligence, these new pricing models are set to become even more widespread and sophisticated.

title: US presidential election: The Central Park Five sue Trump for remarks during the debate
summary: The five men say that the former president 'defamed them in front of 67 million people, which has caused them to seek to clear their names all over again.' On Monday, Democratic candidate Harris campaigned with Republican Liz Cheney to try and get the moderate vote.
